newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Collectors queue for last HK stamps under British.
newsitem.headline: Collectors queue for last HK stamps under British.

text.p: Thousands of Hong Kong collectors queued for the last stamps under British rule on Saturday - a special issue depicting a traditional red English postbox.
The Hong Kong Post bent the rules to frank mail posted on Saturday with June 30 - the date of the territory's handover to China - since post offices are closed on Sunday and Monday.

After the handover old stamps showing the head of Queen Elizabeth and other British insignia may no longer be used and many collectors took the chance on Saturday to have some franked with the handover date.
The new stamp does not bear the queen's head but does carry her ER (Elizabeth Regina) insignia.
Collectors were limited to just 20 of the red postbox stamps, which have a face value of $5 (US$0.65) and celebrate 150 years of the Hong Kong post office.
The stamp was issued only as a sheet for collectors and none is expected to be mailed.
Hong Kong businessman Mike Timperly queued for 30 minutes at Hong Kong's General Post Office. "It is a souvenir and I think it will be valuable in years to come. It was worth queuing for."
